Sentencas: Impurities such as sulfur compounds cause performance degradation in solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs).
Titulo: Density Functional Theory Study of Sulfur Poisoning on Nickel Anode in Solid Oxide Fuel Cells: Effects of Surface and Subsurface Sulfur Atoms

Sentencas: We have studied the sulfur poisoning mechanism on an SOFC nickel anode using density functional theory method, focusing on the effects of surface and subsurface sulfur atoms.
Titulo: Density Functional Theory Study of Sulfur Poisoning on Nickel Anode in Solid Oxide Fuel Cells: Effects of Surface and Subsurface Sulfur Atoms

Sentencas: The binding energy of surface sulfur atoms decreases with an increase in sulfur coverage on the nickel surface.
Titulo: Density Functional Theory Study of Sulfur Poisoning on Nickel Anode in Solid Oxide Fuel Cells: Effects of Surface and Subsurface Sulfur Atoms

Sentencas: Subsurface sulfur atoms become stable relative to surface sulfur atoms at high sulfur coverage.
Titulo: Density Functional Theory Study of Sulfur Poisoning on Nickel Anode in Solid Oxide Fuel Cells: Effects of Surface and Subsurface Sulfur Atoms

Sentencas: A subsurface sulfur phase also appears between sulfur adsorption phase and nickel sulfide phase in the calculated phase diagram for Ni-S systems.
Titulo: Density Functional Theory Study of Sulfur Poisoning on Nickel Anode in Solid Oxide Fuel Cells: Effects of Surface and Subsurface Sulfur Atoms

Sentencas: Influences of sulfur atoms on intermediate adsorbates during surface reactions are also investigated.
Titulo: Density Functional Theory Study of Sulfur Poisoning on Nickel Anode in Solid Oxide Fuel Cells: Effects of Surface and Subsurface Sulfur Atoms

Sentencas: Sulfur hinders the reaction by destabilizing the reaction intermediates on the nickel surface.
Titulo: Density Functional Theory Study of Sulfur Poisoning on Nickel Anode in Solid Oxide Fuel Cells: Effects of Surface and Subsurface Sulfur Atoms
